Our Evaluation Methodology

Learn how we evaluated and ranked these providers using a comprehensive set of criteria

Our rankings are based on a thorough analysis of each provider against a comprehensive set of criteria that we believe are most important for prospective dealer success. Each criterion is weighted based on its relative importance in the overall licensing and business success process.

Our Evaluation Criteria

We evaluated each provider based on the following criteria:

Curriculum Comprehensiveness

Depth and breadth of course content covering regulatory requirements, business operations, and industry best practices.

Weight: 20%

Instructor Qualifications

Experience, expertise, and teaching effectiveness of the instructors delivering the content.

Weight: 15%

Student Success Rates

Historical rates of students successfully obtaining their dealer license after completing the course.

Weight: 15%

Student Support

Availability and quality of support services for students before, during, and after the course.

Weight: 10%

Course Flexibility

Options for scheduling, locations, and delivery methods (online vs. in-person).

Weight: 10%

Cost Value

Overall value for the cost, including additional resources and materials provided.

Weight: 10%

Materials Quality

Quality, relevance, and usefulness of course materials and resources.

Weight: 10%

Industry Connections

Provider's connections to the industry, regulatory bodies, and ongoing support networks.

Weight: 10%

Georgia Independent Automobile Dealers Association (GIADA)

92%

About GIADA

The Georgia Independent Automobile Dealers Association (GIADA) is the premier industry association for independent auto dealers in Georgia. Their pre-license class is taught by industry experts with decades of experience in the automotive retail business and deep knowledge of Georgia's regulatory environment.

Course Details

  • Duration: 4 hours (one day)
  • Cost: $225
  • Locations: Atlanta (Sonesta Atlanta Northwest Galleria), Macon (Anderson Conference Center)
  • Schedule: Monthly classes at each location
  • Course Materials: Informational booklet containing application process steps, compliance requirements, and commonly used forms

What Makes GIADA Stand Out

As the state's leading dealer association, GIADA offers more than just the required pre-license education. Students benefit from the organization's comprehensive industry knowledge, connections to regulatory agencies, and ongoing support network. GIADA can help new dealers establish business relationships with auctions, financial institutions, and service providers crucial to running a successful dealership.

Pros

  • Industry-leading expertise and regulatory knowledge
  • Comprehensive support network for new dealers
  • Access to industry association resources and connections
  • Well-established reputation with Georgia MVD
  • Premium educational materials and resources

Cons

  • Limited location options compared to some providers
  • Slightly higher price point than some competitors
  • Monthly class schedule may require waiting for next available date
  • Classes can fill up quickly, requiring advance registration

Student Testimonials

"The GIADA class was incredibly informative. Their industry connections and deep regulatory knowledge was evident throughout the course. The staff was helpful in answering all my questions about the application process, and the provided materials have been a valuable reference as I set up my dealership."

- Michael T., Atlanta

"As someone new to the auto industry, I found GIADA's pre-license class to be comprehensive and taught at a level that was easy to understand. The instructors took time to explain complex regulations and were available for questions even after the class was over. Highly recommended!"

- Sarah J., Savannah

Georgia Dealer (Automobile Dealer Training Association)

87%

About Georgia Dealer

Georgia Dealer, operated by the Automobile Dealer Training Association, offers comprehensive pre-license training with an emphasis on practical business strategies for new dealers. They stand out for having the most class locations throughout Georgia, making them accessible to prospective dealers across the state.

Course Details

  • Duration: 4 hours (one day)
  • Cost: $250
  • Locations: Atlanta (Airport & Perimeter), Augusta, Columbus, Dalton, Macon, Savannah, Valdosta
  • Schedule: Weekly classes at various locations
  • Course Materials: 150-page copyrighted dealer training manual with comprehensive guidelines and forms

What Makes Georgia Dealer Stand Out

Georgia Dealer excels in providing extensive post-class resources, including online training videos and business strategy guidance. Their one-time tuition includes access to numerous training videos covering topics like dealer floor plans, consignments, identifying odometer fraud, and effective vehicle pricing strategies. Their statewide presence makes them easily accessible regardless of where you're located in Georgia.

Pros

  • Most locations throughout Georgia (7 cities)
  • Extensive online resources and training videos included
  • Comprehensive 150-page training manual
  • Strong focus on business strategies and profitability
  • Weekly class scheduling for greater flexibility

Cons

  • Highest price point among providers
  • Less established industry association connections
  • Some materials focus on sales strategies over compliance
  • Class size can sometimes be larger

Student Testimonials

"The Georgia Dealer class was well worth the investment. The instructor was knowledgeable and the post-class resources have been invaluable as I navigate setting up my dealership. I particularly appreciated the business strategy guidance that went beyond just regulatory compliance."

- Robert L., Columbus

"I found the Georgia Dealer class to be incredibly informative and practical. The 150-page manual has become my go-to reference for all aspects of running my dealership. The online videos were an unexpected bonus that helped reinforce what I learned in class."

- Tammy P., Marietta

Ron E. Widener & Associates

82%

About Ron E. Widener & Associates

Ron E. Widener & Associates brings over 30 years of experience in the Georgia used car industry to their pre-license classes. What sets them apart is their integrated approach combining dealer education with insurance and bonding services, making them a one-stop shop for many dealer licensing needs.

Course Details

  • Duration: 4 hours (one day)
  • Cost: $200
  • Location: Austell, GA (Metro Atlanta)
  • Schedule: Monthly classes
  • Course Materials: Training materials, forms, and templates for dealer operations

What Makes Ron Widener Stand Out

Ron Widener offers a unique value proposition by combining required pre-license education with insurance and bonding services that every dealer will need. As a licensed dealer himself since 1980, Ron brings authentic industry experience to his classes. The integrated service approach streamlines the licensing process for many new dealers.

Pros

  • 30+ years of industry experience as an active dealer
  • Integrated insurance and bond services
  • Competitive pricing
  • Deep understanding of the used car market
  • Consulting services available for dealers

Cons

  • Only one location (Metro Atlanta)
  • Less comprehensive post-class resources
  • Monthly schedule offers less flexibility
  • Fewer training materials compared to other providers

Student Testimonials

"Ron's class was a perfect introduction to the dealer business. I appreciated learning from someone who's been in the industry for decades. The bonus of being able to get my dealer bond and insurance through the same company made the whole process much easier."

- David K., Marietta

"I found Ron's practical industry knowledge incredibly valuable. He focused on real-world scenarios and challenges that dealers face rather than just covering the regulatory requirements. The integrated services saved me a lot of time when setting up my dealership."

- Jennifer W., Kennesaw

Used Auto Dealer Training

78%

About Used Auto Dealer Training

Used Auto Dealer Training differentiates itself by having classes taught by licensed dealers who are currently active in the business. They offer additional unique services including properly zoned office space rental options for new dealers who need to meet location requirements.

Course Details

  • Duration: 4 hours (one day)
  • Cost: $195
  • Locations: Doraville and other locations throughout Georgia
  • Schedule: Bi-weekly classes
  • Course Materials: Training manual and complimentary online course access

What Makes Used Auto Dealer Training Stand Out

Used Auto Dealer Training offers some unique features, including office space rental for dealers having difficulty meeting zoning requirements. Their instructors are active in the car business, bringing current market insights to their classes. They also include a bonus online training course with registration, allowing students to review material after the in-person class.

Pros

  • Lowest price point among providers
  • Classes taught by active dealers
  • Office space rental options available
  • Complimentary online course included
  • Additional specialized courses available

Cons

  • Less comprehensive course materials
  • Fewer industry connections than association-backed providers
  • Smaller operation with fewer resources
  • Limited post-class support compared to competitors

Student Testimonials

"I appreciated learning from instructors who are currently selling cars. They provided practical insights that I've been able to apply immediately in my new dealership. The online course access has been helpful for reviewing concepts after the class."

- Marcus H., Atlanta

"The office space rental option was a lifesaver for me. I was having trouble finding a properly zoned location, and this made getting my license much faster. The instructors were knowledgeable and the class covered all the essentials I needed to know."

Frequently Asked Questions

Common questions about Georgia dealer licensing and training

What is required to get a Georgia used car dealer license?

To obtain a Georgia used car dealer license, you must:

  1. Complete a mandatory 4-hour pre-license educational seminar from a state-approved provider
  2. Have a properly zoned location for your dealership with appropriate signage
  3. Obtain a $35,000 surety bond
  4. Secure garage liability insurance
  5. Pass a fingerprint background check
  6. Complete and submit the dealer license application with all required documentation
  7. Pay the application fee
  8. Pass a location inspection

How long does it take to get a Georgia dealer license?

The process typically takes 4-8 weeks from the time you submit a complete application. This includes time for the background check, processing of your application, and scheduling of your location inspection. Delays can occur if your application is incomplete or if issues are found during the inspection.

How much does it cost to get a Georgia dealer license?

The total cost typically ranges from $1,000 to $1,500, which includes:

  • Pre-license class fee: $195-$250
  • License application fee: Approximately $200
  • Surety bond: $350-$500 (depending on your credit)
  • Garage liability insurance: $300-$600 (varies by location and coverage)
  • Fingerprinting fee: Approximately $50
  • Business license and other local fees: Varies by location

Can I operate a dealership from my home in Georgia?

In some cases, yes. Georgia allows dealers to operate from a residential address if local zoning ordinances permit it. The office must be in a separate building that is detached from the residence, and you must meet all other requirements including proper signage. Urban areas typically have stricter zoning restrictions than rural areas. You must submit a notarized zoning certification from your local zoning authority with your application.

How often do I need to renew my Georgia dealer license?

Georgia dealer licenses must be renewed every two years, by September 30th of even-numbered years. To renew, you must complete 6 hours of continuing education between January and September of the renewal year. You'll also need to maintain your surety bond and garage liability insurance, and pay the renewal fee.

Do I need to attend a pre-license class if I'm buying an existing dealership?

Yes. Even if you're purchasing an existing dealership, if you personally have never held a Georgia dealer license before, you must complete the mandatory 4-hour pre-license educational seminar. The license is issued to the individual or entity applying, not to the physical location.

What's the difference between a retail and wholesale dealer license in Georgia?

A retail dealer license allows you to sell vehicles to both consumers and other dealers. A wholesale license only permits sales to other licensed dealers, not to the general public. Both require the same pre-license education, but a wholesale license may have somewhat different location requirements. Most providers cover both types in their pre-license classes.

Can I get access to dealer auctions with a Georgia dealer license?

Yes. A Georgia dealer license gives you access to wholesale dealer-only auctions. Most auctions require you to register with them and may have additional requirements beyond just having a license. Many will ask for a dealer bond, garage liability insurance, and possibly a bank letter of credit. The pre-license classes typically cover how to get set up with auctions.
